projectTestCaseTags.name: Required Fields Only
projectTestCaseTags.description: Send only required fields with valid values, omitting all optional fields, to test minimal valid requests.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Valid Semantic
projectTestCaseTags.description: Use values that are syntactically correct and also make sense in business logic or domain context.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Enum Combination Coverage
projectTestCaseTags.description: For all enum-type parameters, apply orthogonal design to systematically construct test case combinations of parameters and their enum values, dedicated to testing enum coverage.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Other Positive Case
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide realistic and valid inputs that match API specification, producing correct and expected result.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Missing Required Fields
projectTestCaseTags.description: Omit one or more required fields in request body or parameters.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Invalid Values
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide values that are within correct type and format, but logically invalid for field.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Type Errors
projectTestCaseTags.description: Use values with incorrect data types, such as sending a string instead of an integer.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Format Errors
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide values in an incorrect format, e.g., wrong date pattern, malformed email address.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Semantic Errors
projectTestCaseTags.description: Use syntactically correct and properly formatted values that are logically impossible or violate domain rules.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Other Negative Case
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide invalid or unexpected inputs that should trigger error handling or rejection by API.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Null
projectTestCaseTags.description: Must be JSON literal `null` (not empty, not "null").

projectTestCaseTags.name: Zero
projectTestCaseTags.description: Must be numeric literal 0.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Empty Values
projectTestCaseTags.description: Must be "".

projectTestCaseTags.name: Max Values
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide exact minimum and maximum allowed values for numeric or date fields.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Min Values
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide exact minimum and maximum allowed values for numeric or date fields.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Overflow
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide values just beyond allowed minimum or maximum boundaries.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Underflow
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide values just beyond allowed minimum or maximum boundaries.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Overly Long Strings
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide strings longer than maximum allowed length, or shorter than minimum required length.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Overly Short Strings
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide strings longer than maximum allowed length, or shorter than minimum required length.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Broken Object Level Authorization
projectTestCaseTags.description: Users access or manipulate data objects without proper authorization.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Access Control
projectTestCaseTags.description: Restricting resources and actions users can access based on roles, permissions, or attributes.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Auth Failures
projectTestCaseTags.description: Authentication is weak, misconfigured, or bypassed, allowing unauthorized access.

projectTestCaseTags.name: SQL Injection
projectTestCaseTags.description: Insert malicious SQL code into input fields to test for SQL injection vulnerabilities.

projectTestCaseTags.name: XSS Injection
projectTestCaseTags.description: Inject JavaScript or HTML tags to test for cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Fuzzy Input
projectTestCaseTags.description: Send large or randomly generated payloads to test input validation and stability.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Command Injection
projectTestCaseTags.description: Insert shell commands into inputs to test for command execution vulnerabilities.

projectTestCaseTags.name: JSON Injection
projectTestCaseTags.description: Insert malicious or unexpected JSON structures to test parsing and validation.

projectTestCaseTags.name: NoSQL Injection
projectTestCaseTags.description: Provide NoSQL-specific malicious queries or operators to test for injection vulnerabilities.

projectTestCaseTags.name: Other
projectTestCaseTags.description: Test cases not classified under existing categories.
